meanings.definition: One of the two branches of a biramous limb in certain crustaceans.
meanings.sent1: The endopodites of the crab's leg help it move smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the endopodites of the shrimp under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The endopodites of the lobster's claw waved hello to the curious onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The endopodites of the crayfish's limb danced gracefully in the water.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the endopodites fascinated the marine biologist.

meanings.definition: The inner branch of a biramous appendage in arthropods.
meanings.sent1: The endopodites of the insect's leg were delicate and precise.
meanings.sent2: The endopodites of the spider's pedipalp helped it catch its prey.
meanings.sent3: The endopodites of the beetle's antenna tickled its friend playfully.
meanings.sent4: The endopodites of the scorpion's pincer grasped the prey tightly.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the endopodites stood out against the arthropod's exoskeleton.
